Description: Lower body sherd (mended from six fragments) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with trace of single added white band at top; exterior: band above frieze of alternating lotus flowers and lotus buds.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the frieze pattern, see Oxford AN1912.32a(14) and British Museum 1888,0601.468.j and 1888,0601.468.k. On the lotus and bud frieze, see Lemos 1991, p. 49.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0142) (phase 2)
